channel.title: '86 Mac Plus vs. '07 AMD Dual Core

item.title: '86 Mac Plus vs. '07 AMD Dual Core
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

I think that if the guys from Mac and the people from Microsoft merged together, it would shit out the best OS yet. Think about it, the stability of Mac and the functionality of Windows. And they could combine the UIs to make one really awesome one. That would be the day.

[quote=“DeadBird, post:13, topic:104333”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=149309.msg1416495#msg1416495 date=1180781930]
Lol, I know, funny isn’t it? Its not the first time Mzoft ripped off someone else’s work. Look at Kubuntu and Vista’s UIs, see anything similar?
[/quote]
It’s funny because it’s so false.[/quote]

How so?

Read full topic

item.title: '86 Mac Plus vs. '07 AMD Dual Core
item.dc:creator: @daycrawler daycrawler
item.description:
@daycrawler wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:11, topic:104333”][quote author=daycrawler link=topic=149309.msg1416532#msg1416532 date=1180782317]

Lol, I know, funny isn’t it? Its not the first time Mzoft ripped off someone else’s work. Look at Kubuntu and Vista’s UIs, see anything similar?

Yea well. The funny thing is that Apple didn’t create the icon desktop. It was made by xerox in the 80’s. They built the whole thing and then abandoned the idea after a few bad consumer reports. They were stupid and let Apple engineers into their California plants for free and work with them as they continued to develop stuff with their grant money. Xerox didn’t copyright it and thought apple would be out of the game once they wasted sooo much money on this new icon desktop. In the end they got owned.
[/quote]

Lol, someone should copyright the icon desktop. Then all the other OS’es would be instantly killed off. Good stratedgy for Microsoft. But then again, I don’t think there is someone crazy enough to let that slide.[/quote]
enough people sucked into black hole already

Read full topic

item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“daycrawler, post:10, topic:104333”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=149309.msg1416495#msg1416495 date=1180781930]
Lol, I know, funny isn’t it? Its not the first time Mzoft ripped off someone else’s work. Look at Kubuntu and Vista’s UIs, see anything similar?
[/quote]
Yea well. The funny thing is that Apple didn’t create the icon desktop. It was made by xerox in the 80’s. They built the whole thing and then abandoned the idea after a few bad consumer reports. They were stupid and let Apple engineers into their California plants for free and work with them as they continued to develop stuff with their grant money. Xerox didn’t copyright it and thought apple would be out of the game once they wasted sooo much money on this new icon desktop. In the end they got owned.[/quote]

Lol, someone should copyright the icon desktop. Then all the other OS’es would be instantly killed off. Good stratedgy for Microsoft. But then again, I don’t think there is someone crazy enough to let that slide.

Yea well. The funny thing is that Apple didn’t create the icon desktop. It was made by xerox in the 80’s. They built the whole thing and then abandoned the idea after a few bad consumer reports. Lol, Windows got owned by '86 hardware. Hahahaha, 4 MBs of RAM. I have 2048 times that. (8GB) Still, Windows stole DOS from Mac and they built on it and made the crappiest OSes ever.

…
Where do you get this information? Because it smells like compact bullshit.

item.title: '86 Mac Plus vs. '07 AMD Dual Core
item.dc:creator: @Stroud Stroud
item.description:
@Stroud wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:3, topic:104333”]It doesn’t actually surprise me, because if you think about it, when you buy a computer it comes with useless functions that you never use.
If you think about it, Windows Vista is a prime example of this, 15 gb install is outrages. I don’t know why you need that, when all Vista really is, is XP wrapped in a “better” UI.

I would like to see one of these tests preformed between Xp or Vista and Ubuntu (or other popular Linux distributions).[/quote]

you’re shmartness hurts my bwains

If you think about it, Windows Vista is a prime example of this, 15 gb install is outrages. I don’t know why you need that, when all Vista really is, is XP wrapped in a “better” UI.

I would like to see one of these tests preformed between Xp or Vista and Ubuntu (or other popular Linux distributions).

item.title: '86 Mac Plus vs. '07 AMD Dual Core
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

HubPages

86 Mac Plus Vs. 07 AMD DualCore. You Won't Believe Who Wins

The Most Outlandish Computer Comparison Ever! A 1986 Mac Plus pitted against a 2007 AMD Athlon 64 X2 4800+ DualCore in a series of Microsoft Word & Excel user tests. You will NEVER believe who wins!


I said wow.
